titleStmt.title: A discourse vppon vsurye by vvaye of dialogue and oracions, for the better varietye, and more delite of all those, that shall reade thys treatise. By Thomas Wilson, doctor of the ciuill lawes, one of the masters of her maiesties honorable courte of requestes. Seene & allowed, according to the Queenes Maiesties iniunctions.
titleStmt.author: Wilson, Thomas, 1525?-1581.

titleStmt.title: A discourse vppon vsurye by vvaye of dialogue and oracions, for the better varietye, and more delite of all those, that shall reade thys treatise. By Thomas Wilson, doctor of the ciuill lawes, one of the masters of her maiesties honorable courte of requestes. Seene & allowed, according to the Queenes Maiesties iniunctions.
titleStmt.author: Wilson, Thomas, 1525?-1581.

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: A discourse vpon vsury.
"A conclusion to the louing reader", [3] leaves at end.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
